title: Ticket #3382: Removing a spot instance before instantiation causes it to go on hold.
description: If you remove a spot job before it starts an instance, you go to GM_SPOT_CANCEL, which cancels the spot request and goes to GM_SUBMITTED (in case an instance needs to be stopped). GM_SUBMITTED immediately jumps to GM_CANCEL, because the condorState of the job is still REMOVED. GM_CANCEL tries to stop the instance, but fails -- there not being an instance -- which puts the job on hold. The fix is for GM_CANCEL to only try to stop the instance if we know about one.
